justifications: Sullivan's estimate for Air Force F-35 readiness turns out to be overly optimistic. The real rate is just over half, and slightly better than its cousin the F-22.
The real rate is just over half, and slightly better than its cousin the F-22.
Mattis issued a memo last month to the Air Force and Navy departments giving them just 12 months to get 80 percent of their fighter jets fit for combat.
Mattis directed the services to take a page out of the private-sector playbook, and use the best practices of commercial aviation companies to improve readiness quickly.
The laissez-faire style of leadership is gone and that left with the Obama administration and the commanders that were associated with that.
They were not given the funds, they were not given the certainty they needed to lead their forces.
These guys have the money, they have the personnel, they have the machinery.
Sen. Dan Sullivan, a subcommittee chairman, said while questioning Air Force Secretary Heather Wilson.
Sen. Dan Sullivan, a subcommittee chairman, said while questioning Air Force Secretary Heather Wilson and Gen. David Goldfein, the Air Force chief of staff.
